It is with this same relentless determination and urgency that I join my colleagues and environmental groups from across the nation to urge Congress to pass this bill NOW.

The American people deserve better transparency. This bill will deliver that by requiring proper labeling.

I'm proud to name this bill after Matt Haller, an Illinois resident who passed away from stomach cancer that is believed to have been linked to the local EtO sterilization plant near his home.

Matt fought for his community to shut down this plant. I'm proud to say he succeeded.

Carcinogenic chemicals like EtO are banned for food sterilization in countries across Europe but not in the US.

In fact, regulations don't even require labeling to let consumers know if these chemicals were used.

I'm introducing the Matt Haller EtO Awareness Act to change that. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1506028000118145027/pu/img/cYkqR6Nae3A3PbXC.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1506028000118145027/pu/vid/320x320/4Mi_dD684ZoBxrZy.mp4?tag=12
